data.title: Hershey's Q3 2025 financial results exceed expectations with strong net sales and earnings; updates 2025 outlook.
data.description: Hershey, Pennsylvania, October 30, 2025 - The Hershey Company (HSY) disclosed their net sales and earnings for the third quarter ending on September 28, 2025. They also provided an updated 2025 outlook range. The company exceeded expectations in the third quarter due to robust innovation and strategic brand initiatives.

data.title: RPC, Inc. (NYSE: RES) announces Q3 2025 financial results. No specific numbers provided. Company declares regular quarterly cash dividend.
data.description: Atlanta, on October 30, 2025, RPC, Inc. (NYSE: RES) shared unaudited data for the third quarter ending on September 30, 2025. As a prominent oilfield services company, RPC provided insights into its financial performance during this period. Key highlights include non-GAAP and adjusted metrics such as adjusted revenues. The company's diversified offerings cater to various aspects of the oilfield services industry.

data.title: Corus Entertainment reported a 14% decrease in revenue for Q4, net loss of $277.1 million in the quarter, and free cash flow of negative $25.2 million. CEO highlights TV advertising challenges and cost savings. For fiscal 2026, they anticipate continued lower demand for linear advertising. (Character count: 278)
data.description: Corus Entertainment Inc. reported a decrease in consolidated revenue by 14% for the quarter and 11% for the year. The consolidated segment profit decreased by 39% for the quarter and 33% for the year, resulting in a consolidated segment profit margin of 11% for the quarter and 17% for the year. Net loss attributable to shareholders amounted to $277.1 million for the quarter and $328.4 million for the year, with a loss per share of $1.39 for the quarter and $1.65 for the year. Free cash flow was negative $25.2 million for the quarter and negative $21.8 million for the year. The company's net debt to segment profit increased from 3.84 times in August 2024 to 6.01 times in August 2025. Despite industry challenges, the company remains committed to expanding its digital offerings and enhancing its portfolio of premium brands and content. Operational highlights include the launch of a strong fall schedule across Global and specialty networks, with increased streaming hours. Various cost-saving initiatives were implemented. Corus outlined expectations for fiscal 2026, anticipating continued low demand for linear advertising and implementing additional cost reduction initiatives to manage expenses. The company reported non-IFRS financial measures alongside its IFRS results, including segment profit, segment profit margin, free cash flow, adjusted net income attributable to shareholders, adjusted basic earnings per share, and net debt to segment profit. More financial details, risks, uncertainties, and outlook are provided in the report.

data.title: Cardinal Health's Q1 FY 2026: Revenue up 22% to $64B, GAAP operating earnings up 18% to $668M, GAAP diluted EPS up 11% to $1.88. Non-GAAP operating earnings increased 37% to $857M.
data.description: The company reported a 22% increase in revenue to $64 billion. GAAP operating earnings saw an 18% rise to $668 million, with GAAP diluted EPS increasing by 11% to $1.88. Non-GAAP operating earnings also showed a significant increase of 37% to $857 million, attributed to segment profit growth in all five operating segments of the company.

data.title: CNX Resources Corp (NYSE: CNX) reports Q3 2025 results posted online. More info on company's website.
data.description: CNX Resources Corporation (NYSE: CNX) based in Pittsburgh disclosed its financial and operational performance for Q3 2025 via its official website. The company posted the results online today. This information includes key data such as revenue, net income, expenses, and operational achievements. The detailed Q3 figures and statements regarding the company's performance can be found on CNX's website.

data.title: Lilly's Q3 2025 revenue hits $17.6B, EPS rises to $6.21 reported and $7.02 non-GAAP. 2025 revenue guidance raised to $63B.
data.description: In the third quarter of 2025, revenue saw a significant surge of 54%, reaching $17.60 billion, primarily attributed to the increased volume from Mounjaro and Zepbound. During the same quarter, the earnings per share (EPS) showed a notable improvement, rising by $5.14 to $6.21 based on reported figures and by $5.84 to $7.02 on a non-GAAP basis. Consequently, the company raised its full-year revenue projection for 2025 to a range of $63.0 billion.

data.title: Columbus McKinnon sees 8% sales growth in Q2 FY26, confirms guidance.
data.description: In Charlotte, North Carolina on October 30, 2025, Columbus McKinnon Corporation (Nasdaq: CMCO), a prominent provider of intelligent motion solutions for material handling, shared its fiscal year financial performance. Columbus McKinnon, a respected designer, manufacturer, and marketer in this industry, revealed crucial figures without specifying the actual amounts. This update emphasizes the company's position in the market and its commitment to delivering innovative solutions for material handling needs.

data.title: Intraoperative Radiation Therapy market set to double by 2030 due to rising cancer cases and precision oncology.
data.description: In Austin, Texas and Tokyo on October 30, 2025, data from DataM Intelligence reveals that the Intraoperative Radiation Therapy Market is on the rise due to increased technological advancements and clinical acceptance. This growth is driven by the worldwide increase in cancer cases and a shift towards precision medicine.

data.title: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. (FLWS) reports Fiscal 2026 Q1 results, focusing on growth & stabilization for future success.
data.description: In Jericho, New York, 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. (NASDAQ: FLWS) announced its results for the Fiscal 2026 first quarter ending on September 28, 2025. The company, known for providing meaningful expressions to encourage customers to enhance their connections and relationships, highlighted this fiscal year as crucial for stabilizing their operations and setting the groundwork for lasting growth. They expressed optimism for the future, as their turnaround strategy begins to yield positive results.

data.title: Asetek to release Q3 2025 financial results on Nov 4 at 12pm CET; CEO and CFO to discuss at 2.30pm.
data.description: In Aalborg, Denmark, Asetek is set to announce its financial performance for the third quarter of 2025 on November 4, around 12 pm CET. CEO André Sloth Eriksen and CFO Peter Dam Madsen will further discuss the company's results on the same day at 2.30 pm.

data.title: CSW Industrials reports record results for fiscal Q2 2026 ending September 30, 2025.
data.description: CSW Industrials, Inc. (NYSE: CSW) announced today that it has achieved record-breaking results for the fiscal 2026 second quarter ending on September 30, 2025, in Dallas.

data.title: Romania boosts EU's crypto adoption as per Chainalysis report, focusing on MiCA framework for dynamic market growth.
data.description: A recent report by Chainalysis has emphasized the rise of the cryptocurrency market in Europe, specifically pointing out Romania as a promising area for growth within the European Union's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) framework. This indicates Romania's potential as a lucrative market for cryptocurrencies within the EU. The report sheds light on the increasing interest and opportunities in the crypto sector in Europe, with Romania emerging as a dynamic player in this evolving landscape.

data.title: Australian authorities utilize 'Crypto Safe Cracker' to recover $6M in hidden cryptocurrency, exposing suspect's attempt to manipulate code.
data.description: The Commissioner of the Australian Federal Police disclosed that a single analyst's hunch led to the discovery of millions in cryptocurrency that a suspect had attempted to conceal using altered code.

data.title: SimiTree introduces CLARITY real-time revenue cycle analytics dashboard for transparency. #HealthTech #FinTech
data.description: SimiTree, a company based in Hamden, Connecticut, specializing in revenue cycle, coding, and consulting services for post-acute and behavioral health sectors, has unveiled a new product named CLARITY. This real-time analytics dashboard aims to offer comprehensive insights into revenue cycle performance. SimiTree, which is backed by Sheridan Capital Partners, introduced SARA, its proprietary AI platform for improving clinical documentation review earlier this year.

data.title: Anthropic presents Claude Sonnet 4.5, the updated AI model with enhanced coding and agentic capabilities for improved productivity in diverse fields.
data.description: Anthropic has unveiled the Claude Sonnet 4.5, their newest AI model that boasts major improvements in coding, intricate task handling, and alignment, showcasing a leap in productivity across diverse fields.

data.title: Eagle Materials Q2 results: Revenue $638.9M, Net earnings $137.4M, EPS $4.23, Adjusted EBITDA $233.3M.
data.description: In Dallas today, Eagle Materials Inc. (NYSE: EXP) announced their financial performance for the second quarter of fiscal 2026 ending on September 30, 2025. Key highlights for the quarter include record revenue reaching $638.9 million and net earnings of $137.4 million. The net earnings per diluted share were reported to be $4.23. Additionally, they disclosed an Adjusted EBITDA of $233.3 million. It is important to note that all comparisons are made with the prior year’s fiscal second quarter.
